Title: Rsp.Windows.Forms
Description:
This project includes several custom Button types, Windows Form types, a numeric textbox and a custom MessageBox class.

* RoundedButton - A button with rounded corners.

* ShadedButton - A button with customizable shine.

* ColorizedButton - A button with customizable Tint color for specified background image.

* NumericTextBox - Textbox allowing only numeric input.

* MsgBoxUI - Alternative to Windows MessageBox with a nicer look.

* ShadowedForm - Windows form with a shadow.

* RoundedForm - Windows form with a rounded corner and a fancy title bar.

* AnimatedForm - Windows form with open and close animations.

This is a project I did several years ago when I was learning GDI+ so I thought of sharing it with others. I have referred to numerous GDI+ code samples and tutorials in the leraning process and creating this project. So my gratitude goes to all those unnamed developers whom I got help from. Special thanks goes to my friend Kasun Chandranath for Win32 help.

Feel free to use/modify the provided source code to experiment with your own ideas and incorporate in your own applications.

Project Description
This project includes several custom Button types, Windows Form types, a numeric textbox and a custom MessageBox class that you can use in your Windows Forms projects.

Refer to Documentation for screenshots.

* RoundedButton - A button with rounded corners.

* ShadedButton - A button with customizable shine.

* ColorizedButton - A button with customizable Tint color for specified background image.

* NumericTextBox - Textbox allowing only numeric input.

* MsgBoxUI - Alternative to Windows MessageBox with a nicer look.

* ShadowedForm - Windows form with a shadow.

* RoundedForm - Windows form with a rounded corner and a fancy title bar.

* AnimatedForm - Windows form with open and close animations.

This is a project I did several years ago when I was learning GDI+ so I thought of sharing it with others. I have referred to numerous GDI+ code samples and tutorials in the leraning process and creating this project. So my gratitude goes to all those unnamed developers whom I got help from. Special thanks goes to my friend Kasun Chandranath for Win32 help.

Feel free to use/modify the provided source code to experiment with your own ideas and incorporate in your own applications.

Notes
This project was initially created by me in 2006 using Visual Studio 2005. At the time of the upload, the project was converted to Visual Studio 2010 format (as I didn't have VS2005). But it still targets .Net Framework 2.0 runtime version. So if you have an older VS version than Visual Studio 2010, you can create a blank project and add these files to your project and it will work.
